Context: Students in Early Childhood Education program have been completing one-month study abroad internships at Regent International Preschool in Suzhou, China since 2008. The Tiger Hill historical site visited by the students is significant as it has a history that goes back 2,500 years and contains many traditional houses with artistic elements like calligraphy, musical instruments, furniture, and paintings. There is a bonsai garden in the area with over 600 unique and aesthetic pots of Bonsai on display. Tongli, also known as Water Town, visited by the students is a national park and 1,000-year old heritage site of China, known for its water canals and ancient bridges. It contains gardens, halls, residential areas, restaurants, and shops selling traditional clothing among other products.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Talk Back China 2019 - School of Early Childhood | George Brown College.txt

Context:
Tongli is a water town in China, known for its blend of history, art, nature, food, shopping, and Chinese culture. It has shops clustered into groups where merchants sell traditional clothing, handmade combs, silk scarves, jewellery, wood carvings, toys, and Chinese foods and beverages. Visitors can also explore Chongben Hall, a traditional marriage house for the people of Jiangnan Water Town, to witness traditional wedding customs.

Mother's Day is celebrated in a special way at Suzhou Regent International Preschool. Preparations for the event start weeks in advance and include the use of newly constructed play spaces for mothers and grandmothers to spend quality time with their children. The mothers are devoted to their children and education, and their love is evident when they participate in activities together. Each child-mother team does games and art activities together, resulting in unique expressions of their relationship. The day ends with the children giving their mothers a present, but the memories made are the true gift.

As an international student at George Brown College, you have studied early childhood education in Canada but attended kindergarten as a child in China. You were curious about how Kindergarten looks now in China and visited a local lab school in Suzhou to find out.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Talk Back China 2019 - School of Early Childhood | George Brown College.txt

Context: The Kindergarten in Suzhou has a play-based curriculum that they have worked hard to develop. They believe every child is like a flower and are responsible for creating the best environment for their growth and giving them love. The Kindergarten provides various environments for children to play, such as water play, sand areas, mud areas, and playgrounds where they build towers using blocks. The attraction, Tiger Hill Pagoda, in Suzhou is located on a hill and is known for its traditional houses with artistic elements like calligraphy, musical instruments, furniture, and paintings. There are more than 600 pots of Bonsai displayed in the area around the tower. The visit to Tiger Hill made the author realize the importance of details.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Talk Back China 2019 - School of Early Childhood | George Brown College.txt
